At the same time, I think it’s just common sense to have solid background checks, mental health screenings, and proper training requirements so guns stay out of the wrong hands. We don’t need more laws that punish law-abiding citizens, but we do need to enforce the ones we have and focus on safety, responsibility, and respect for life.

statement: Como alguien que vino de Cuba y vio lo que pasa cuando el gobierno tiene todo el poder y la gente no puede defenderse, creo que la Segunda Enmienda es una protección fundamental que no se debe debilitar. Debe haber leyes que eviten que las armas caigan en manos de criminales y personas claramente peligrosas, pero no reglas que castiguen al ciudadano cumplidor o le hagan casi imposible poseer y portar un arma. Para mí, el equilibrio es revisar bien a quien compra, castigar con dureza el uso ilegal, y dejar en paz al dueño responsable que solo quiere proteger su hogar y su libertad.

I support the Second Amendment and respect responsible gun ownership, but I also believe in strong, common-sense gun safety laws—like universal background checks, safe storage requirements, and limits to keep weapons of war out of everyday circulation. Protecting our kids and our communities should take priority, and smart regulation doesn’t have to mean taking away people’s rights.

The balance is protecting responsible ownership while coming down hard on illegal possession and misuse.

statement: At my age, I’ve seen far too many families shattered by gun violence to believe that “doing nothing” honors the Second Amendment. I respect that many Americans cherish the right to own a firearm, but with rights come responsibilities, and we desperately need strong universal background checks, safe storage requirements, and restrictions on weapons designed for mass killing. To me, that’s not taking freedom away—it’s using a bit of common sense and compassion to protect our neighbors, just as I tried to do as a nurse.

statement: I think people should be allowed to own guns because the Second Amendment is part of our country’s history and how some families protect themselves, but there need to be strong safety rules so kids and innocent people don’t get hurt. Things like background checks, safe storage laws, and training requirements seem fair, because they don’t take guns away from responsible owners, they just help prevent tragedies.
